I think it depends on what you want to do with the headphones that determines if a particular headphone is better than AirPods for an intended purpose. If you’re into high end audio, you want to listen o quality recordings and get the best possible fidelity, then I would say that most wired headphones are probably going to be better. If you want a headphone that is going to be a constant companion, be used for phone calls while driving, music for working out, and you use an Apple device, they may be the best. Supposedly the PowerBeats Pros, another Apple product, are very good too though.

Case: Small, portable, holds a lot of battery, quick charge, magnetics connection for the earbuds. Ergonomic and looks good.Connection, if you have an iphone or ipad, it will seamlessly connect once you take it out of the case. Then each time after, it auto connects. Really convenient and easy.Latency, other buds have this, but airpods have the lowest latency of the bunch, which means they are better than most for watching tv or movies with them. Less out of sync talking.Quick independent play, just put one in the case and have to other out, start playing music. You don't have to switch on a separate mode, or go into an app. It just works..At this point they are actually cheaper than most others options like the jabra elite 65t, bose soundsport free, sony wf1000xm3, beats Powerbeats pro. All of which are at least $170.

I’m a fan of the EarPods for the price. With a little EQ you can get them sounding really good. I was against wireless headphones until I was gifted a pair of AirPods for Xmas. I never wanted to buy them because for $160 I couldn’t imagine them sounding much different than the $30 wires version. I’m literally sitting on my flight now waiting. To take off listening to Steely Dan on my AirPods. They do sound noticabley better than the wired EarPods. Bass is more controlled and deeper and the mods are a bit more open. Highs are smoother. Is it a significant improvement over the EarPods, no. Is it it a noticeable improvement, yes. And I don’t even need to do an AB comparison. And they are damn smart headphones. I didn’t think I’d enjoy going wireless this much.

They’re not just good, they’re great. Why? They do sound good. They have good microphones. They have decent battery life and a neat charging system. But these aren’t what make them fantastic. It’s the pairing. It’s the secret sauce that Apple ladled over the top of the Bluetooth connectivity. They pair with your iPhone instantly. And then when you answer your phone and you realize you’re going to be on for more than a minute or two, you pop them out of the case, put one in your ear, and bang. The call has been transferred to them. Other wireless Bluetooth headphones do not work this seamlessly. It may seem like a small thing, but I have 2–3 other wireless headsets around my apartment. They’re all sitting in drawers full of junk with dead batteries because they just weren’t that practical to use. AirPods are game changers in this regard.

No. But they are not intended to sound better. I own both EarPods and AirPods. I’m a music composer so I have the ear for these kinds of things. For me, there is a big difference in audio quality between the two. The bitrate is significantly lower on AirPods and they just don’t provide the immersive sound that the EarPods do. It’s expensive because of the custom Apple-designed chip that allows you to pair it easily without going through a traditional Bluetooth pairing process. You’re paying for an Apple experience, not audio quality. It is top notch though, I’m not saying it’s bad for being a Bluetooth pair of headphones. It’s among the best when comparing to other Bluetooth earphones, but no where near the wired EarPods when it comes to audio quality.

Well technically Apple AirPods are earphones, made by Apple, so by definition they can not sound better then themselves. So no. However we can rescue this question by pretending you are talking about the EarPods v. AirPods. Before I got mine I assumed they would sound the same, but actually the bass sounds a little better, but the rest is about the same. I have multiple other better sounding headphones, but the AirPods are my daily use headphones because they are super lightweight & convenient to use. I have for real gone to look for my AirPods only to find them already in my ears! That doesn’t happen with my etymotics. Ever.
